target_claim: The Valley of Flowers National Park is a nature reserve in the western Himalayas in Uttarakhand, India. It has an area of 87.5 square kilometers (33.8 sq mi) and has no permanent population. Being part of the Nanda Devi Biosphere Reserve, it is one of the last refuges for the Asiatic black bear and snow leopard.
